svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Air quality index vs GDP per capita, 2015
Air quality index (where 100 = best, and 0 = worst) versus gross domestic product (GDP) per capita, measured in
2011 international-$. The air quality index is an environmental performance indicator which combines three
variables: household air quality, ambient (outdoor) exposure to particulate matter smaller than 2.5 micrometres
(PM2.5) and the exceedance rate of PM2.5 recommended limits.
Source: World Bank – WDI, Environmental Performance Index via the Quality of Government dataset
